uk.ac.cf.cs.scm5mjw.mda.io
Class SimpleXMLWriter

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.cf.cs.scm5mjw.mda.io.SimpleXMLWriter

public class SimpleXMLWriter
extends java.lang.Object

This class handles outputting XML to a file an a easy to use manner. It essentially uses the Xerces package (http://xerces.apache.org/xerces-j/) behind the scenes. The aim of this class is to allow the use of Xerces in an easy and quick to use fashion.
This class is designed SPECIFICALLY with output for the mobile communication simulator in mind.

Constructor Detail

SimpleXMLWriter

public SimpleXMLWriter(java.io.File inFile)
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                       java.io.IOException
This constructor will set up an output to the given file and prepare for XML to be written.
As soon as this constructor is finished, XML is ready to be outputted. (Note that this does NOT, however, write any tags to the document. startDocument() is NOT yet called.)

Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException
java.io.IOException

public void startDocument()
                   throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
Indicates the beginning of the document.

Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException

endDocument

public void endDocument()
                 throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
Indicates the end of the document.

Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException

elemDouble

public void elemDouble(java.lang.String elemName,
                       double value)
                throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
This method will add an element containing a value to the document.
The element will also be given an attribute to indicate the data (value) it encloses is of type double.

Note that this will output a complete element (i.e. start AND end tags).

Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException

elemInt

public void elemInt(java.lang.String elemName,
                    int value)
             throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
This method will add an element containing a value to the document.
The element will also be given an attribute to indicate the data (value) it encloses is of type integer.

Note that this will output a complete element (i.e. start AND end tags).

Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException

elem

public void elem(java.lang.String elemName,
                 java.lang.String value)
          throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
This method will add an element containing a value/string to the document. The element will have no attributes.

Note that this will output a complete element (i.e. start AND end tags).

Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException

print

public void print(java.lang.String str)
           throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
This method will print the string to the current XML element in the XML document.
Note that this will not begin or end a new or existing XML element. Thus users should be careful not to break the XML format (e.g. by printing text directly after an XML end tag if that text is not put in its own element).

Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException

startElement

public void startElement(java.lang.String elemName)
                  throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
This method will begin an element in the document (thus allowing nesting of elements). The element will have no attributes.

Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException

endElement

public void endElement()
                throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
This method will end the most recent element to be started in the document. The element will have no attributes.

Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException

close

public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
This method will close the output stream and release and resources that were associated with it.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
